options.text: Rendering using shaders that most closely simulate the real-world behavior and properties of light.
Rendering in 3D using materials designed to look like real objects.
Rendering that uses normal maps and height maps to simulate physical variations on a mesh.
Rendering that uses a combination of vertex and fragment shaders to achieve realistic results.

feedbackCorrect: PBR simulates the real-world principles of physics and light to generate realistic shadows, reflections, ambient light, and other effects of light on 3D surfaces.
feedbackIncorrect: Shaders and materials work together to define all the characteristics of a mesh surface during the rendering process. A material is an asset that works with a shader to define how meshes will be rendered.
